comments.html: Thanks for the input! We'll have to put this one off for the later becase now we have to focus on the core features - admin interface, login system and the ease of installation and upgrades.
also the basic on-screen notifiation system about new responses is still missing - this one will be done soon.

also the basic on-screen notifiation system about new responses is still missing - this one will be done soon.

https://github.com/fitoria/askbot-devel/tree/postman, not merged yet into the trunk. There is a way to send email to users in the "moderation" tab on their profiles, but it is a simple email only feature.

Typically moderators have a hidden sub-forum for group discussions that discuss things that need to be private like the question of banning a particular user. I wonder if something like that is possible here
I too think this would be a very useful feature, based upon my experience with MetaOptimize.

answers.summary: http://expats.qais a resource for expats of all experience levels to exchange knowledge.Having been active on a few other expat-related sites (most notably Sovereign Man Confidential and International Man), I got frustrated by some of the limitations I found with traditional forum-based knowledge sharing.Askbot is a fantastic alternative to the traditional threaded discussion format:No open-ended discussions; the focus is exclusively on questions and answers.A karma system makes it possible to have an effectively self-moderated community.Tags are first-class citizens, making it easier for individuals with similar interests to find each other.The site is in beta for the next few months until we've reached a critical mass of new users and experts.  We look forward to seeing you there!

answers.summary: +1 This would be an excellent feature to keep experts on a site; not everyone gets a thrill out of answering questions, but high-karma users would be able to use this feature to network and gain [additional] value.I would suggest a few requirements, though:Users should have the ability to specify that they only want users with a minimum amount of karma to be able to message them (e.g., experts might only want to network with other experts).Users should have the ability to add usernames to a block list ("blacklist") if they do not (or no longer) want to receive messages from those other users.Alternatively, users should have the option to switch to "whitelist" mode whereonlythe usernames they list will be permitted to message them.A minimal amount of karma should be required before a user can send any private messages (to prevent spam and other forms of abuse).Having a public wall would be interesting, although the profile screen is already so busy, I'm not sure where it would go!
